Description: Wooden figure of a man, probably Ramses I, standing with left foot advanced, wearing bag-wig and kilt, the eyes and eyebrows were originally inlaid, the arms are missing (although one tenon, now detached, does survive), the figure probably held a mace in the right and a stave in the left hand, one leg and both feet are restored, the whole bears traces of a layer of bitumen.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: Giovanni Battista Belzoni
Curator's comments: Published: PM I Part 2: p.535 T. Phillips [ed.], Africa, London 1995, p. 88-89 [1.50] = T. Phillips [ed.], Afrika, Berlin 1996, pp. 88-89 [1.50].
